verses.verse: The wicked one flees and none are pursuing, but the righteous ones are as bold as a lion.
By transgression in a land many are its rulers, but by a discerning man who knows, it is thus prolonged.
A poor man that oppresses the weak one is like a sweeping rain that leaves no food.
Those forsaking the law praise the wicked one, but those keeping the law strive with them.
Evil mankind does not understand judgment, but those seeking Jehovah understand all.
Better is the poor one walking in his integrity than the crooked one of ways, even if he is rich.
One keeping the law is a wise son, but one feeding those being worthless shames his father.
There is one who increases his wealth by interest and by usury, but one pitying the weak ones gathers it.
He who turns aside his ear from hearing the Law, even his prayer is a disgusting thing.
One leading astray the upright one in an evil way shall fall into his own pit; and the blameless one shall inherit good.
A rich man is wise in his own eyes, but the discerning poor one examines him.
When the righteous ones rejoice, great is the glory, but when the wicked ones rise, a man will be sought out.
One covering his transgressions will not prosper, but the one confessing and forsaking them shall have pity.
Blessed is the man who is always in awe of God! But he who hardens his heart falls into an evil way.
The wicked ruler is a roaring lion and a ranging bear over a poor people.
The ruler that lacks understanding even adds extortionate deeds, but one hating unjust gain prolongs his days.
A man pressed down with the blood of a soul shall flee to the pit; let them not uphold him.
One walking blamelessly shall be saved, but a crooked one in his ways shall fall at once.
He who works his ground shall have plenty of bread, but one pursuing vanities shall be sated with poverty.
A faithful man shall be full of blessings, but one pressing to be rich shall not be free from guilt.
To recognize faces is not good, and for a piece of bread a man will transgress.
A man with an evil eye is anxious for wealth, but he does not know that poverty will come on him.
He who reproves a man afterwards finds grace, more than he who flatters with the tongue.
He who robs his father or his mother, and says, It is not a transgression, he shall be a partner to a man who corrupts.
The proud in soul stirs up strife, but he who is trusting on Jehovah shall be made fat.
One trusting in his own heart is a fool, but the one walking in wisdom shall be delivered.
The one giving to one being poor shall not lack, but the one hiding his eyes shall have plenty of curses.
When the wicked ones rise, a man hides himself; but when they perish, the righteous ones multiply.
